api_list.name: Talent list
api_list.description: The data is divided into 26 pages of 500 records. To get data, you need to specify the required page
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://theclique.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/the_right_fit/{page}"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "theclique.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Artist short info
api_list.description: You can get brief information on several artists at the same time. It is enough to enter the ID of the artists through a comma

api_list.name: Genres
api_list.description: For each country, the content of genres is different. You can get genres for almost any country. You just need to enter in the field 'country' Alpha-2 code. For example, Australia - AU, United Kingdom - UK, USA - US

api_list.name: Agency Clients
api_list.description:
This endpoint provides an opportunity to obtain data on players and managers (if any) whose representative is the required agency. There is a pagination. 25 clients on one page. Pagination is applied immediately to both players and managers. 
For example, the agency has 5 pages with players and 2 pages with managers. If we choose page = 2, we get data from the 2nd page of players and the 2nd page of managers. If we choose page = 4, we will get data from the 4th page of players and the 2nd page of managers

api_list.name: Moshtix
api_list.description:
You just need to enter the name of the event or artist. You will receive information about all available events.
A few clarifications to get the correct answer:

1. If the name contains the symbol + or /, please shorten the name to the beginning of this symbol. For example, searching by name "Y&O Sundays w/ Vetta Borne // Ra Ra Viper // Edith // Ricky's Breath" will not give results. But if will use shorted name "Y&O Sundays", you will get the desired result.

2. If the name is too long, try to shorten it sensibly. For example, searching by name "SEADECK SYDNEY - SOUNDS LIKE SUNDAYS FT. J. WORRA - Sunday 20th November" will not give results. But if will use shorted name "SEADECK SYDNEY - SOUNDS LIKE SUNDAYS", you will get the desired result.

The reasons for these clarifications arise from the specific work of the Moshtix site search engine. 
Thank you for your understanding and I wish you pleasant work ;)
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://theclique.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/moshtix/{event_name}"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "theclique.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Everything
api_list.description:
Search through millions of articles from over 80,000 large and small news sources and blogs.

This endpoint suits article discovery and analysis.

optional_parameters.name: domains
optional_parameters.description: A comma-seperated string of domains (eg bbc.co.uk, techcrunch.com, engadget.com) to restrict the search to.

optional_parameters.name: q
optional_parameters.description:
Keywords or phrases to search for in the article title and body.

Advanced search is supported here:

    Surround phrases with quotes (\\\\\\\") for exact match.
    Prepend words or phrases that must appear with a + symbol. Eg: +bitcoin
    Prepend words that must not appear with a - symbol. Eg: -bitcoin
    Alternatively you can use the AND / OR / NOT keywords, and optionally group these with parenthesis. Eg: crypto AND (ethereum OR litecoin) NOT bitcoin.

The complete value for q must be URL-encoded. Max length: 500 chars.

optional_parameters.name: exclude_domains
optional_parameters.description: A comma-seperated string of domains (eg bbc.co.uk, techcrunch.com, engadget.com) to remove from the results.

optional_parameters.name: language
optional_parameters.description:
The 2-letter ISO-639-1 code of the language you want to get headlines for. Possible options: **ar**, **de**, **en**, **es**, **fr**, **he**, **it**, **nl**, **no**, **pt**, ~~ru~~, **sv**, **ud**, **zh**.

Default: all languages returned.

optional_parameters.name: from_param
optional_parameters.description:
A date and optional time for the oldest article allowed. This should be in ISO 8601 format (e.g. **2023-01-22** or **2023-01-22T17:10:27**)

Default: the oldest according to your plan.

optional_parameters.name: sort_by
optional_parameters.description:
The order to sort the articles in. Possible options: **relevancy**, **popularity**, **publishedAt**.
relevancy = articles more closely related to q come first.
popularity = articles from popular sources and publishers come first.
publishedAt = newest articles come first.

Default: **publishedAt**

optional_parameters.name: to
optional_parameters.description:
A date and optional time for the newest article allowed. This should be in ISO 8601 format (e.g. **2023-01-22** or **2023-01-22T17:10:27**)

Default: the newest according to your plan.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description:
Use this to page through the results.

Default: **1**.

optional_parameters.name: page_size
optional_parameters.description:
The number of results to return per page.

Default: **100**. Maximum: **100**.

api_list.name: Top Headlines
api_list.description:
This endpoint provides live top and breaking headlines for a country, specific category in a country, single source, or multiple sources. You can also search with keywords. Articles are sorted by the earliest date published first.

This endpoint is great for retrieving headlines for use with news tickers or similar.

optional_parameters.name: q
optional_parameters.description: Keywords or a phrase to search for.

optional_parameters.name: category
optional_parameters.description: The category you want to get headlines for. Possible options: **business**, **entertainment**, **general**, **health**, **science**, **sports**, **technology**. Note: you can't mix this param with the sources param.

optional_parameters.name: page_size
optional_parameters.description: The number of results to return per page (request). 20 is the default, 100 is the maximum.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Use this to page through the results if the total results found is greater than the page size.

optional_parameters.name: country
optional_parameters.description: The 2-letter ISO 3166-1 code of the country you want to get headlines for. Possible options: **ae**, **ar**, **at**, **au**, **be**, **bg**, **br**, **ca**, **ch**, **cn**, **co**, **cu**, **cz**, **de**, **eg**, **fr**, **gb**, **gr**, **hk**, **hu**, **id**, **ie**, **il**, **in**, **it**, **jp**, **kr**, **lt**, **lv**, **ma**, **mx**, **my**, **ng**, **nl**, **no**, **nz**, **ph**, **pl**, **pt**, **ro**, **rs**, ~~ru~~, **sa**, **se**, **sg**, **si**, **sk**, **th**, **tr**, **tw**, **ua**, **us**, **ve**, **za**. Note: you can't mix this param with the sources param.

api_list.name: Transfermarkt details
api_list.description:
Enter **SLUG ** from Transfermarkt search API.

It os working for all types (players, clubs, managers, referees, etc)
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://theclique.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/transfermarks_detail/{part_slug}/{other}/{type_s}/{id_talent}"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "theclique.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: SongKick search Artist
api_list.description:
Enter the name of the artist.
For example, ed sheran
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://theclique.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/songkick_search/{artist_name}"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "theclique.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: TuneFind for Details
api_list.description:
Please, enter the slug of artist. For example, taylor-swift or acdc.
You can get a slug  by using the TuneFind Search API
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://theclique.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/tune_find_details/{artist_slug}"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "theclique.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get info about artist
api_list.description:
Give info about artist on allmusic.com

Response -> json
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://theclique.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/get_info_artist/{parameter}"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "theclique.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Aldi
api_list.description: Aldi product
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://theclique.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/aldi"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "theclique.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://theclique.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/aldi"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "theclique.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
